sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

All 8 vocabulary words:

govern → ?        company → ?
job → ?           American → ?
British → ?       French → ?
German → ?        Japanese → ?

(Answers: turni, kagni, jibri, merko, brito, fraso, dotco, ponjo)

Grammar Summary (3-4 min)

Advanced Topics Covered

Topic Key Elements
MEX li, su'i, vu'u, pi'i, fe'i, du
Pro-bridi broda, brode, brodi
Elision ku, kei, ku'o, vau optional
Non-logical joi, ce, ce'o

Week 29 Vocabulary

Lojban English Lojban English
turni govern kagni company
jibri job merko American
brito British fraso French
dotco German ponjo Japanese

Self-Test (5-6 min)

Part A: Vocabulary (8 points)

Translate:

  1. turni →
  2. jibri →
  3. merko →
  4. ponjo →

Translate to Lojban:

  1. company →
  2. British →
  3. French →
  4. German →
Answers
  1. govern/rule
  2. job
  3. American
  4. Japanese
  5. kagni
  6. brito
  7. fraso
  8. dotco

Part B: Advanced Grammar (8 points)

Translate:

  1. 3 + 4 = 7
  2. 10 ÷ 2 = 5
  3. I eat. You [do the same]. (use broda)
  4. Alice and Bob (together) carry it. (use joi)

Answer:

  1. Which terminator ends sumti?
  2. Which terminator ends abstraction?
  3. What does ce do?
  4. What does ce'o do?
Answers
  1. li ci su'i vo du li ze
  2. li pano fe'i re du li mu
  3. mi citka .i do broda
  4. la .alis. joi la .bob. cu bevri ri
  5. ku
  6. kei
  7. Set-and (list members)
  8. Sequence-and (ordered)

Part C: Integration (4 points)

Translate:

  1. The Japanese company is big.
  2. I think that 2 × 3 = 6.
Answers
  1. lo ponjo kagni cu barda
  2. mi jinvi lo du'u li re pi'i ci du li xa

Integration Challenge (1-2 min)

Combine all advanced tools:

Write sentences using:

  • MEX
  • Pro-bridi
  • Elision (drop unnecessary terminators)
  • Non-logical connectives
  • Culture words

Example:

li mu pi'i mu du li remu
.i mi joi do cu djuno ri
.i mi merko .i xu do broda
.i mi tadni lo fraso ce lo dotco bangu

(5 × 5 = 25. We together know this. I'm American. Are you [American] too? I study French and German languages.)

Week 29 Complete Reference

Vocabulary (8):

Lojban English Lojban English
turni govern kagni company
jibri job merko American
brito British fraso French
dotco German ponjo Japanese

Grammar:

Topic Elements
MEX li, su'i, vu'u, pi'i, fe'i, du
Pro-bridi broda, brode, brodi, brodo, brodu
Elision Most terminators optional
Non-logical joi (mass), ce (set), ce'o (sequence)

Cumulative vocabulary: ~236 words

Summary

You completed Week 29 on advanced topics. You can now do math in Lojban, use pro-bridi, elide terminators, and use non-logical connectives.

Next week preview: Week 30 is the final review and graduation week — comprehensive review of all 30 weeks.
